result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription    **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

11:12 AM Defendant Valerie Jean Wilson appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.    Court finds probable cause for the charge.
 
 BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
  **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to contact the Public Defender office.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Status hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
